DtScriptedTaskMetaData.myMenuText: Perform Task and Respond to Interruption
DtScriptedTaskMetaData.myDescription: This task functions as a general case that can be used to perform some idle task indefinitely, but if interrupted by some reactive task, change behavior to some new task when ready to resume. Input parameters are not configurable for the subtasks, so suitable defaults must be in place.

myVariables.item: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes" ?> <!DOCTYPE boost_serialization> <boost_serialization signature="serialization::archive" version="9"> <DtScriptedTaskVariable class_id="0" tracking_level="0" version="3"> <myVariableName>idleTask</myVariableName> <myType>string</myType> <myLabel>Idle Task</myLabel> <myToolTip>Initial idle task to perform prior to being interrupted</myToolTip> <myDefaultValue></myDefaultValue> <myRangeBottom>-100000</myRangeBottom> <myRangeTop>100000</myRangeTop> <myVariableData></myVariableData> <myVisible>1</myVisible> <myIndent>0</myIndent> <myInternal>0</myInternal> </DtScriptedTaskVariable>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes" ?> <!DOCTYPE boost_serialization> <boost_serialization signature="serialization::archive" version="9"> <DtScriptedTaskVariable class_id="0" tracking_level="0" version="3"> <myVariableName>resumeTask</myVariableName> <myType>string</myType> <myLabel>Task on Resume</myLabel> <myToolTip>Task to perform when resuming after interruption from a reactive task</myToolTip> <myDefaultValue></myDefaultValue> <myRangeBottom>-100000</myRangeBottom> <myRangeTop>100000</myRangeTop> <myVariableData></myVariableData> <myVisible>1</myVisible> <myIndent>0</myIndent> <myInternal>0</myInternal> </DtScriptedTaskVariable>
